metadata.Title: CVE-2010-3703 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The PostScriptFunction::PostScriptFunction function in poppler/Function.ccin the PDF parser in poppler 0.8.7 and possibly other versions up to0.15.1, and possibly other products, allows context-dependent attackers tocause a denial of service (crash) via a PDF file that triggers anuninitialized pointer dereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3703` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xpdf - 3.02-12ubuntu1
No subscription required

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler58 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
poppler-utils - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xpdf package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.02-12ubuntu1').
poppler package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.16.0-0ubuntu2').
libextractor: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
